bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Jacob Shook was a butcher and grocer operating in Richmond, Va., during the mid-nineteenth century.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Jacob Shook Daybook, 1828-1832, records the daily transactions of the Richmond area butcher and grocer. Information found in each entry includes the date, customer name, type of transaction, name and quantity of items purchased, and monies debited or credited to the customers' individual accounts. Items purchased include various types and cuts of meat such as lamb, sausage, beef, veal, fish, and mutton. Customers also bought grocery items including eggs, asparagus, lettuce, and potatoes. The last few pages of the volume record Jacob Shook's purchases of cattle.
